page.title: 03The Village of Easton.
page.content: There are approximately 125-130 {houses and cottages}in the village and most of them date back to 1900-1980, although some are much older. Most of the{cottages}have beautiful thatched roofs with figures carved out. These were once{farm labourers cottages}but are now expensive private dwellings. One we particularly took notice of was a white and black house with a peacock and fish carved on the top. Most of the houses had{gardens}some of which are quite large. There are four streets in{Easton}all meeting at the cross-roads. We saw that there were two or three{G.P.O.post boxes}and the collections are at 09.45am. and later on at 16.15pm. There is a{bus service twice a week. It is a very pretty village indeed.
